creator: miroslav.sulc@startnet.cz
text:
Yesterday I have upgraded our intranet server to version 2.0.47. This stopped
mod_negotiation from working. I had tested both static and shared module but
with no difference.

I am not aware of any change that I would do in my httpd.conf file. I have just
built and installed the new Apache, run it and the negotiation didn't work.

If you need more information please ask for them. Is I am not a specialist to
Apache I do not know what this problem might be related with.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
You'll need to provide more information about the symptom (what page is failing
to be chosen correctly, what is the mod_negotiation-related configuration for
that page, what is browser willing to accept).

Also, it would be very helpful for you to try using the mod_negotiation you had
from a prior Apache release to see it it works in your config.

Thanks!

creator: miroslav.sulc@startnet.cz
text:
What pages:
Apache manual pages

Configuration:
Default

Browser accepts:
Languages: cs, en-us, en

Old module:
The module was previously compiled as static so I cannot use it.

Browser gets this:

URI: index.html.de
Content-Language: de
Content-type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

URI: index.html.en
Content-Language: en
Content-type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

URI: index.html.fr
Content-Language: fr
Content-type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

URI: index.html.ja.jis
Content-Language: ja
Content-type: text/html; charset=ISO-2022-JP

URI: index.html.ko.euc-kr
Content-Language: ko
Content-type: text/html; charset=EUC-KR

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Configuration default 2.0.47? The documentation configuration has been changed
in 2.0.47.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
No further response. Assuming issue resolved.

Please reopen the bug if this is not the case and you can provide the requested
information.

Thanks for using Apache.
